channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Murder probe after Bury woman dies from severe burns
item.description: Three men are arrested in connection with the death of the 31-year-old in Bury, Greater Manchester.

item.title: Goole WW2 bomb: Army experts carry out controlled explosion
item.description: Army bomb disposal experts detonate the 500lb (227kg) device found on a new-build housing estate.

item.title: Fatuma Kadir: Missing 11-year-old Bolton girl is found
item.description: Fatuma Kadir, who travelled from Bolton to London, is found after police mount a nationwide search.

item.title: Chess: The 12-year-old boy taking the game by storm
item.description: "Shrez" has been playing chess since he was five and wants to become world champion one day.

item.title: Man arrested after car hits group of people on Blackpool North Pier
item.description: The driver fled the scene but police later arrested a 30-year-old man on suspicion of attempted murder.

item.title: Nestlé Newcastle: 'You think a sweet factory will be there forever'
item.description: Nestlé's factory in Newcastle is set to close in two years with the loss of more than 500 jobs.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Partner informed of 'remains' find in Pyrenees
item.description: Esther Dingley disappeared on a solo walk near the France-Spain border in November.

item.title: Liverpool sinkhole appears after water main bursts
item.description: Work to repair the 6m (20ft) hole in Liverpool is expected to take at least two weeks to complete

item.title: Parkrun: Northampton runner, 88, completes 400th event
item.description: Bob Emmerson says he now wants to get to 500 runs as he "can't give it up".

item.title: Coronavirus: Mum urges 'get jab' after son hospitalised
item.description: Aiden's mum says it "infuriates" her when parents presume their children will not get ill.

item.title: Open water: Swimmers urged not to take chances
item.description: It is thought 28 people have lost their lives in open water during the recent hot weather.

item.title: Cornwall beach dog dies after swallowing fish hook
item.description: Terrier Mabel was taken to an animal hospital but suffered a ruptured artery in an operation.

item.title: Lightning destroys roofs as storms end heatwave in southern England and Wales
item.description: Southern Britain is hit by heavy rain but there is a sunny start to school holidays further north.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Mental health: Derbyshire man pulls sack of coal to Newcastle
item.description: Ben Robertson pulls coal 120 miles to Newcastle to raise awareness of mental health.

item.title: The young imam using Instagram to change opinions
item.description: Sabah Ahmedi wants to show imams can "have a laugh", have "a bit of banter" and "wear colourful socks".

item.title: 'People have never seen anything like this before'
item.description: Live-streamed footage of a family of blue tits has had more than 41 million views online.

item.title: Supermarket worker: ‘I take pride in my job and in myself’
item.description: Ola Cole Kalejaye says she is proud to have kept a vital service running for the community during the pandemic.

item.title: Covid-19: DJ SUAT takes nightclub on to the streets
item.description: After coronavirus shut the nightclubs he DJs in, SUAT, of Oxted, took his decks on to the streets.

item.title: Frank Varey: Teenage boxing champion dies after river swim
item.description: Tributes are being paid to Frank Varey, 16, whose body was pulled from the River Dee in Cheshire.

item.title: Oxfordshire lake death: Mother pays tribute to 'caring' daughter
item.description: Nicole Sanders was one of six people who died last weekend after having problems in water in England.

item.title: Essex lorry deaths: Man ordered to pay £3k to families
item.description: Alexandru-Ovidiu Hanga made £83,552 from crime but just £3,000 is available, the Old Bailey hears.

item.title: The Smithy Family quit TikTok after arson attack
item.description: Nick Smith told followers the family were "taking time to fix themselves" after the house fire.

item.title: Trapped squirrel freed from inside Cambridge lamp-post
item.description: An RSPCA inspector says it was one of the more unusual animal rescues he has attended.

item.title: Keon Lincoln: Teenager denies murdering 15-year-old Birmingham boy
item.description: Four other youths have also denied murdering Keon Lincoln, who was shot and stabbed in Birmingham.

item.title: Man Utd manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer signs new deal until 2024
item.description: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer signs a new deal with the club until 2024, with an option for a further year.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: Lions fight back to clinch series opener
item.description: The British and Irish Lions draw first blood in the Test series against world champions South Africa after fighting back from nine points down at the break.

item.title: The Hundred: Jemimah Rodrigues leads Northern Superchargers to victory
item.description: Jemimah Rodrigues plays the innings of The Hundred to almost single-handedly take Northern Superchargers to victory over Welsh Fire.

item.title: T20 debut on Sunday, Hundred matchwinner on Friday - Benjamin stars in thrilling Phoenix win
item.description: Unknown 22-year-old Chris Benjamin leads Birmingham Phoenix to a stunning last-gasp victory over London Spirit in the men's Hundred.
